verses.text: Blessed \add is\add* the man that hath a virtuous wife, For the number of his days \add shall be\add* double.
A virtuous woman rejoiceth her husband, And he shall fulfil the years of his life in peace.
A good wife \add is\add* a good portion, \add Which\add* shall be given in the portion of them that fear the Lord.
\add Whether a man be\add* rich or poor, \add if he have\add* a good heart toward the Lord, He shall at all times rejoice with a cheerful countenance.

\add There be\add* three \add things that\add* mine heart feareth; And for the fourth I was sore afraid: The slander of a city, the gathering together of an \add unruly\add* multitude, And a false accusation: all \add these are\add* worse than death.
\add But\add* a grief of heart and sorrow \add is\add* a woman \add that is\add* jealous over \add another\add* woman, And a scourge of the tongue which communicateth with all.
An evil wife \add is\add* a yoke shaken to and fro: He that hath hold of her \add is\add* as though he held a scorpion.
A drunken woman and a gadder abroad \add causeth\add* great anger, And she will not cover her own shame.
The whoredom of a woman may be known in her haughty looks and eyelids.
If thy daughter be shameless, keep \add her\add* in straitly, Lest she abuse herself through overmuch liberty.
Watch over an impudent eye: And marvel not if she trespass against thee.

She will open her mouth, as a thirsty traveller when he hath found a fountain, And drink of every water near \add her:\add* By every hedge will she sit down, And open her quiver against \add every\add* arrow.
The grace of a wife delighteth her husband, And her discretion will fat his bones.
A silent and loving woman \add is\add* a gift of the Lord; And there is nothing so much worth as a mind well instructed.
A shamefast and faithful woman \add is\add* a double grace, And her continent mind cannot be valued.
\add As\add* the sun when it ariseth in the high heaven; So \add is\add* the beauty of a good wife in the ordering of her house.
\add As\add* the clear light is upon the holy candlestick; So \add is\add* the beauty of the face in ripe age.
\add As\add* the golden pillars \add are\add* upon the sockets of silver; So \add are the\add* fair feet with a constant heart.
\add My\add* son, keep the flower of thine age sound; And give not thy strength to strangers.
When thou hast gotten a fruitful possession through all the field, Sow \add it with\add* thine own seed, trusting in the goodness of thy stock.
So thy race which \add thou\add* leavest shall be magnified, Having the confidence of their good descent.
A harlot shall be accounted as spittle; But a married \add woman\add* is a tower against death to \add her\add* husband.
A wicked woman is given \add as\add* a portion to a wicked \add man:\add* But a godly \add woman\add* is given to him that feareth the Lord.
A dishonest woman contemneth shame: But an honest woman will reverence \add her\add* husband.
A shameless woman shall be counted as a dog; But she that is shamefast will fear the Lord.
A woman that honoureth her husband shall be judged wise of all; But she that dishonoureth \add him\add* in \add her\add* pride shall be counted ungodly of all.
A loud crying woman and a scold Shall be sought out to drive away the enemies.

\add There be\add* two \add things that\add* grieve my heart; And the third maketh me angry: A man of war that suffereth poverty; And men of understanding that are not set by; \add And\add* one that returneth from righteousness to sin; The Lord prepareth such a one for the sword.
A merchant shall hardly keep himself from doing wrong; And a huckster shall not be freed from sin.
